metadata.title: CVE-2023-1073 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A memory corruption flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s human interfacedevice (HID) subsystem in how a user inserts a malicious USB device. Thisflaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privilegeson the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1089.96').
